evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: A. Declaring that Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order are unlawful and null and void.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declaring that Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order are unlawful and null and void.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: B. Declaring that the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025, Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs, is unlawful as applied to AFSA.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declaring that the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025, Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs, is unlawful as applied to AFSA.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: C. Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all his agents and subordinates from implementing Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all his agents and subordinates from implementing Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: D. Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all agents and subordinates from implementing the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025, Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs with respect to AFSA.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all agents and subordinates from implementing the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025, Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs with respect to AFSA.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: E. Enjoin Defendants State, USAID, and Rubio from continuing to fail to recognize AFSA as the exclusive representative of the members of the Foreign Service employed by State and USAID and order their agents and subordinates to restore AFSA’s collective bargaining agreements with State and USAID and to honor the agreements’ provisions and any of the Statute’s provisions concerning dues allotments, official time, use of and access to agency resources including office space.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Enjoining Defendants State, USAID, and Rubio from continuing to fail to recognize AFSA as the exclusive representative of the members of the Foreign Service employed by State and USAID and order their agents and subordinates to restore AFSA’s collective bargaining agreements with State and USAID and to honor the agreements’ provisions and any of the Statute’s provisions concerning dues allotments, official time, use of and access to agency resources including office space.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: F. Awarding Plaintiff reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Awarding Plaintiff reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: G. Ordering such further relief as the Court may deem just and appropriate.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Ordering such further relief as the Court may deem just and appropriate.
